data.title: Sae Ackerstein, Madalyn Price to compete at International Surf Rescue Challenge | Local Roundup
meta_keywords: International Surf Rescue Challenge at South Padre Island
data.meta_description: Two Santa Cruz athletes, Sae Ackerstein and Madalyn "Munchie" Price, have been selected to represent the United States as part of the Youth National Team at the International Surf Rescue Challenge at South Padre Island, Texas, on Sept 17-24.
data.text:
Two Santa Cruz athletes, Sae Ackerstein and Madalyn “Munchie” Price, have been selected to represent the United States as part of the Youth National Team at the International Surf Rescue Challenge at South Padre Island, Texas, on Sept. 17-24.

They’ll compete against athletes from Australia, Canada, Japan, New Zealand and South Africa.

Ackerstein (Santa Cruz City) and Price (Capitola) were tapped for Team USA after outstanding performances at regional and national competitions over this summer.

Ackerstein swept the craft events at regionals (board paddle race, surfski race, ironwoman race) and then collected two silvers and a bronze in those events at nationals, as well as making Open finals in each.

Price dominated her peers at both tournaments, winning the U19 flags and making the Open finals.

Girls water polo

Pioneer 9, at Harbor 8: The Pirates suffered a narrow loss in nonleague action Thursday.

Harbor (0-2) takes on Atascadero (1-3) to open the Central Valley Showdown at Clovis High on Friday at 6:40 p.m.

Boy water polo

Westmont 16, at Harbor 9: The Pirates trailed 8-3 at the half and dropped their nonleague match Thursday.

Girls volleyball

At Harbor 3, Salinas 1: Junior sett Maren O’Farrell had 15 assists, 12 kills, and nine digs in the Pirates’ 25-21, 20-25, 25-20, 25-21 win in nonleague action Thursday.

Junior outside hitter Isla Johnson had 12 kills and two aces for the Pirates. Junior middle blocker Sabine Kemos had 11 kills and three blocks, and senior libero Gwen Grigsby had 16 kills and five assists.

Harbor (7-3) hosts Hollister on Friday at 6:30 p.m.

St. Francis 3, Kirby 0: Carley Anderson had five kills, two blocks, and two aces in the Sharks’ 25-9, 25-13, 25-22 sweep Thursday.

Samantha Martinez had four aces and 10 assists for the Sharks. Julie Lopez had two aces and five kills, and Delaney Fowler had two aces and four kills.

Men’s volleyball

Landel named head coach: UC Santa Cruz named Jacob Landel as its men’s volleyball head coach Wednesday.

Landel served as the Banana Slugs’ interim head coach the past two seasons. UCSC went 14-16 in ’22, and 21-13 in ’23, when it qualified for the NCAA D-III Tournament.

A 2015 All-American at UCSC, Landel had been an assistant the three prior seasons before being named interim head coach in 2021.

Women’s volleyball

Sierra 3, at Cabrillo 1: Anna Hospodar had 10 kills and eight digs in the Seahawks’ 25-17, 21-25, 25-21, 25-11 loss Wednesday.

Renee Parker had six kills and hit .417 for Cabrillo (0-1). Paola Jacobs had seven kills and 10 digs, and Mikaila Kronholm made 32 assists.

Feather River 3, at Cabrillo 1: Paola Jacobs had 11 kills and six digs, and teammate Kelea Saxton had 10 kills and nine digs in the Seahawks’ 22-25, 25-16, 25-16, 25-9 loss Wednesday.

Anna Hospodar had four kills and 10 digs for the Seahawks, and Mikaila Kronholm ad 31 assists.

Cabrillo (0-2) hosts Alameda (0-1) on Sept. 6 at 6:30 p.m.

Girls tennis

At Scotts Valley 7, Monte Vista Christian 0: The Falcons won every match in straight sets and secure the nonleague win Thursday.

In singles play, senior Stella Cheney beat Annabelle Contreras 6-0, 6-1 at No. 1; sophomore Aila Papadopoulos defeated Naomie Barbier 6-0, 6-0 at No. 2; Scotts Valley junior Erin Szymanski beat Rachel Xiao 6-0, 6-3 at No. 3 and senior Maya Bensen defeated Julia Guerra 6-1, 6-2 at No. 4.

In doubles action, senior Samantha Warner and junior Sofia Niklaus combined for a 6-2, 6-0 victory over Kailyn Kaiser and Sophia Sheridan at No. 1; sophomore Maya Wexler and freshman Montserrat Burgos beat Alexa Contreras and Alandra Guzman 6-0, 6-1 at No. 2 and senior Kendal Wright and freshman Georgia Chetcuti defeated Cloe Morrow and Carol Jun 6-2, 6-0 at No. 3.

The Falcons, (2-0) host Santa Cruz to open Santa Cruz Coast Athletic League play Sept. 19 at 4:30 p.m.

Reporting Scores

Coaches are encouraged to report scores and highlights to sports@santacruzsentinel.com following games. Please include your name and contact number in the email.
